Somewhat glitched in communicating information to the students and faculty, University Police are very vigilant and make great effort to protect the people of this institution.
From the traditional to the professional, a variety of Greek life exists on campus.
Hundreds of clubs exist in this university. There is a club for most anything one can think of.
Great if you like large populations with the ability to escape easily when needed.
Most importantly, we sing John Denver's Country Roads for most any occassion. We also REALLY dislike the University of Pittsburgh.
While tuition continues to climb annually, WVU still remains one of the most affordable institutions in the region.

Outdoors and indoors, the Monongalia County region has much to do. Coopers Rock State Park is just a few miles east of town, providing hiking, climbing, ziplining, and outdoor exploration to anybody looking to escape the hustle of the city and relax. Night life in the city is similar to what you would find in any major city. Clubs line up downtown, and music venues dot the city, giving way for fans of rock, country, hiphop, and everything in the middle to experience their favorite artists live. Pittsburgh is only a 90 minute drive north, as well.

The many dining areas on campus give students the opportunity to try a variety of different foods on any given day, at any given time, at any given location. From large cafeterias to small cafes, WVU provides students with a variety of options to suit their wants and needs.

Buildings both new and old, WVU's student housing provides everything you need to be comfortable in Morgantown. Each dorm has a variety of clubs and events, from arts clubs to hall council to talent shows.

The academics at this institution are top-notch. Rigorous coursework coupled with opportunities, both provided and self-made, provide the knowledge necessary to make a career in any person's given interests.

WVU gives you the chance to interact one-on-one with skilled educators who have experience in their respective fields. Like any other college, you will learn the skills needed to make a successful future. What makes this university special is that opportunities always surround you, and in order to make the most of what you have, you can't be afraid to make things happen for yourself.

Nestled in the hills of north central West Virginia, WVU is a land-grant university that has served the state since 1867. Despite having a population of over 30,000 students, one can still feel the tie associated with a small school while still living in a modern, urban area. A very diverse social and cultural atmosphere blends with academics that provide opportunities beyond what one can imagine, harboring an environment of creativity while fostering a future of success.

textAfterTable: Login to rate or flag the reviews Kayla from Clarksburg, WV 10/14/2010 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of 14 people found this review useful. 3 of 163 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Wow, with a campus like WVU it is great for any type of student. Seriously, any stereotype, any click from the athlete to the nerd, from the music major to the chemistry loving geek, from country to hard rock, white, black and every color in between you will fit in at WVU. The diversity here is amazing. I frequently spend my lunch just people watching and enjoying all the variety WVU has to offer. I myself have been challenged to look beyond who I am and reinvent who I will become. At am a musician, playing in the orchestra, a nerd in the honors program, an athlete running and attending spinning classes daily, a teacher working with students at a local school, a mentor for teenagers at the rec center, a room mate and friend to several girls from all over the country. WVU is great for all
